title: Foxconn to invest an additional $170 million in Lordstown Motors; Companies also agree to jointly develop an electric vehicle
text:
Additionally, Foxconn and Lordstown Motors said they would jointly develop their first electric vehicle together, declining to provide further details about the project.

The investment by Foxconn, a contract manufacturer best known for its work with Apple Inc. AAPL, is the latest cash infusion into the electric-truck startup, which a little more than a year ago was in danger of running out of money.

An expanded version of this report appears on WSJ.com.
